item.title: Coronavirus: Little evidence of Covid transmission in schools, says Williamson
item.description: The education secretary says a new coronavirus study supports the government decision to reopen schools.

item.title: Coronavirus: Australia records deadliest day but fewer new infections
item.description: An outbreak in Victoria has seen over 100 deaths in the past week, but new infections may be slowing.

item.title: Migrant crossings: Use of navy ships to stop boats 'dangerous'
item.description: A Calais politician says the measures to stop boats crossing the Channel "won't change anything".

item.title: Dawn Butler: MP calls for 'system change' after police stop
item.description: Dawn Butler accused police of racial profiling after a car she was in was stopped in east London.

item.title: Detectorist 'shaking with happiness' after Bronze Age find
item.description: A metal detectorist discovers a rare hoard of Bronze Age artefacts during an expedition near Peebles.

item.title: Jimmy Lai: Hong Kong media tycoon arrested under security law
item.description: The prominent pro-democracy supporter is accused of foreign collusion under controversial new laws.

item.title: Belarus election: Clashes after poll predicts Lukashenko re-election
item.description: A state TV exit poll shows victory for President Alexander Lukashenko - but the opposition cries foul.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Death toll rises to 200 as third minister resigns
item.description: The governor of Lebanon's capital says dozens remain missing, as a third cabinet minister resigns.

item.title: Police officer run over by thieves backs 'Andrew's Law'
item.description: PC Gaz Phillips who nearly died just days before PC Andrew Harper is supporting his widow's campaign for tougher sentences.

item.title: Body of 12-year-old girl found in river near Loch Lomond
item.description: The girl's body was found after a three-hour search around Balloch Bridge, near Loch Lomond.

item.title: Simon Cowell thanks medics after breaking back in electric bike fall
item.description: The music mogul says he should have "read the manual" before riding his new electric bicycle.

item.title: One in three UK firms 'expect to make redundancies'
item.description: Research suggests a third of UK organisations plan job cuts, a 50% increase on three months ago.

item.title: Whale migration: ‘Super rare’ whale encounter on the Great Barrier Reef
item.description: A dive instructor has recorded his ‘special moment’ with a humpback whale.

item.title: The Papers: 'Testing time for schools' and uni places in peril
item.description: Reaction to Boris Johnson's pledge to reopen schools in England fully next month features on many of Monday's front pages.

item.title: Keith Mason and fiancée go viral after inspirational posts
item.description: Keith Mason and Riona Kelly have been posting about her recovery and it's become a lockdown hit.

item.title: Coronavirus: Students 'selling clothes to pay rent'
item.description: There has been a large increase in students applying for emergency help since lockdown.

item.title: Islamic State in Iraq: 'How I survived an IS massacre'
item.description: Iraqi soldier Ali Hussein Kadhim recollects his miraculous escape from the massacre that killed hundreds of other cadets.

item.title: Police racism inquiries in the UK: Do they change how things work?
item.description: After George Floyd and Black Lives Matter protests questions were asked again about British policing.

item.title: Beirut explosion: DJ finds 'sense of relief' in music
item.description: 28-year old DJ and music producer 'june as' is one of the thousands of people trying to piece back his life after the blast.

item.title: Coronavirus: Is the world winning the pandemic fight?
item.description: Covid-19 has changed the world - are we winning or is the virus still taking hold, and when will it end?

item.title: Coronavirus Vietnam: The mysterious resurgence of Covid-19
item.description: A central Vietnamese city is back in lockdown as researchers search for the source of a new outbreak.

item.title: 'It will break my heart to have to walk away'
item.description: Why has the number of self-employed people started to fall?

item.title: Trump WeChat ban 'an unwelcome signal' for Chinese community
item.description: For China's global community, the app provides a vital means of staying in touch with home.

item.title: 'People told me my plans for a skincare firm were crazy'
item.description: When Tata Harper was setting up her US cosmetics brand, she was told it would never work.

item.title: Social media trolling affects almost a third of elite British sportswomen, BBC Sport survey finds
item.description: Elite British sportswomen speak out about "horrific abuse" on social media, telling a BBC Sport survey about constant comments they receive.

item.title: Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg: Tottenham medical for Southampton midfielder
item.description: Southampton's Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg is having a medical at Tottenham on Monday, while Kyle Walker-Peters is set to move the other way.

item.title: American Morikawa, 23, holds off England's Casey to win US PGA Championship
item.description: American Collin Morikawa emerges from a stacked leaderboard to win the 2020 US PGA Championship after a flawless final round in San Francisco.

item.title: Social media trolls: BBC Sport strengthens stance against hateful messages
item.description: BBC Sport strengthens its stance against social media trolls with a new policy for responding to hateful messages.

item.title: 'It feels like harassment' - sportswomen share social media trolling stories
item.description: A BBC Sport survey uncovered shocking examples of social media abuse sent to sportswomen. Here are three women's stories in their own words.

item.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan says he could 'lose an arm' and still be in the top 50 during extraordinary interview
item.description: Watch Ronnie O'Sullivan's extraordinary interview after beating Ding Junhui in which he says young players coming into the game now are so bad that he would need to "lose an arm and a leg" to fall out of the top 50.

item.title: 'We're happy to go to court' - Wolff challenges rivals to protest against Mercedes in 'copying' row
item.description: Toto Wolff challenges rivals to lodge a protest if they believe Mercedes have broken the rules in the Racing Point 'copying' controversy.

item.title: Europe lockdown: New coronavirus rules country by country
item.description: What are European countries doing to control new coronavirus outbreaks?

item.title: Coronavirus: How can I use the 'eat out to help out scheme'?
item.description: Thousands of venues will take part in a discounting scheme to help boost the hospitality industry.

item.title: How will I get my A-level, GCSE or BTec exam results this year?
item.description: Exams in the UK were cancelled this year, but how are students learning their results?

item.title: Coronavirus: What is a second wave and is one coming?
item.description: What are second waves and how big a problem are they?

item.title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: A new continuous cough and fever are also symptom,s but how do you know what to look for?

item.title: When does the stamp duty holiday end?
item.description: The government has announced changes to stamp duty to help cut costs for anyone buying a home.

item.title: Coronavirus: How will schools reopen fully?
item.description: Schools are set to go back for the autumn term, but scientists say society may have to make trade-offs.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the risks of opening schools?
item.description: Children seem to be at low risk from the disease, but can they still spread it?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK's travel rules and which countries can you visit?
item.description: New rules mean people entering the UK from certain countries will not have to quarantine.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key charts and maps explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Coronavirus in the UK: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: What happens when the furlough scheme ends?
item.description: Almost 10 million people have accessed the scheme, which closes in October.

item.title: Coronavirus immunity: Can you catch it twice?
item.description: Immunity is the crucial question and understanding it will tell us how the pandemic will end.

item.title: Coronavirus: What am I allowed to do in the hot weather this weekend?
item.description: Hot weather is expected across the UK this weekend, but how do you stay within the rules?

item.title: Coronavirus: Where can I now go on holiday in the UK?
item.description: Where can I go and what can do on a holiday in the UK?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the new lockdown rules for Preston and other areas?
item.description: Preston has become the latest place to impose restrictions. But how does a local lockdown work?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: Belgium, Bahamas and Andorra are the latest places from where people must quarantine on arriving in the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Social distancing and lockdown rules are changing in England - but what can you now do?

item.title: Coronavirus: Can I get travel insurance and what are my travel rights?
item.description: As quarantine rules are relaxed, holidays are back on the agenda

item.title: Coronavirus: How to stay cool in a face mask as hot UK weather forecast
item.description: Temperatures are forecast to top 30C in some parts of the UK this weekend. Perhaps it is not the time you want to be partially covering your face.

item.title: NBA: Black Lives Matter and basketball’s role in discussion on racism
item.description: Basketball is perhaps the sport best placed to challenge racial inequality. Is the NBA doing it right?
